text: Paul Sherwen (7 June 1956 â€“ 2 December 2018) was an English professional racing cyclist and later a broadcaster on cycling. He worked with NBC and commentated on the Tour de France. He raced in seven editions of the Tour, finishing five. He raced for the Athletic Club de Boulogne-Billancourt and for the Raleigh Bicycle Company. Sherwen was born in Widnes, Lancashire. He died on 2 December 2018 at his home in Kampala, Uganda from heart failure at the age of 62.Iconic voice of cycling Paul Sherwen dies at 62-years-old. Retrieved: 2 December 2018.Tributes from Phil Liggett, David Millar and more as cycling broadcaster Paul Sherwen dies at 62 ==References== Category:1956 births Category:2018 deaths Category:Deaths from heart failure Category:British cyclists Category:English sports commentators Category:Sportspeople from Lancashire
title: Paul Sherwen
